problem.p: A small block of mass m sits on a horizontal and frictionless table. It is attached to a wall by a spring. The block is initially located at x = 0 when the spring is unstretched (equilibrium position). You pull the block away from the equilibrium position, out to x = A, and then release it. The block then oscillates horizontally back and forth in simple harmonic motion.
Which of the statements below are true about the magnitude of the acceleration? Check all that apply.

choice.text: The magnitude of the acceleration of the block is maximum at x = A
The magnitude of the acceleration of the block is maximum at x = 0
The magnitude of the acceleration of the block is maximum at x = -A
The magnitude of the acceleration of the block is maximum at x = A/2
